アニメやホテルに神社までも…所沢に来年、角川が「聖地」

05 Nov 2019, 09:21



高さ約８メートルの巨大本棚に囲まれた「本棚劇場」（ＫＡＤＯＫＡＷＡ提供）

　出版大手の「ＫＡＤＯＫＡＷＡ」と公益財団法人角川文化振興財団は、埼玉県所沢市東所沢和田で建設を進めている「ところざわサクラタウン」の概要を発表した。施設全体のオープンを来年７月１７日とし、美術館、博物館、図書館の機能を兼ね備えた複合施設や、アニメ観賞ができるホテルを開設する。
　１０月３１日に東京都内で行われた事業発表会で施設の概要などを公表した。一般客が来場して楽しめる施設のうち、拠点となるのは「角川武蔵野ミュージアム」で、複合文化ミュージアムと位置づけている。新国立競技場の設計も手がけた建築家・隈研吾氏による設計で、５階建ての建物は岩を多角形に組み合わせたような外観。中には高さ約８メートルの巨大本棚に囲まれた「本棚劇場」や「マンガ・ラノベ図書館」、アニメを文化と捉えて紹介する「ＥＪアニメミュージアム」などが設けられる。
　室内でアニメ観賞が楽しめる「ＥＪアニメホテル」は全３３室で建設。また、この地をアニメの聖地などとして来場する人たちに向け、「武蔵野坐令和神社（むさしのにますうるわしきやまとのみやしろ）」と名付けた神社も新設する。
　来年６月６日に角川武蔵野ミュージアムがプレオープンするのを手始めに、各施設が順次開業していく。ＫＡＤＯＫＡＷＡの書籍製造工場や事務所機能も随時移転し、２０２１年４月には全面開業となる。同社などは開業後の来場者を、従業員と一般客を合わせて年間１４０万～１８０万人と見込んでいる。
text:
Anime, hotels and even shrines ... Next year in Tokorozawa, Kadokawa is a “holy place”

05 Nov 2019, 09:21



"Bookshelf Theater" (provided by KADOKAWA) surrounded by a huge bookshelf about 8 meters high

"KADOKAWA", a major publishing company, and the Kadokawa Foundation for Cultural Promotion announced the outline of Tokorozawa Sakura Town, which is currently under construction in Tokorozawa Wada, Tokorozawa City, Saitama Prefecture. The entire facility will be opened on July 17 next year, and a complex facility that has the functions of an art museum, a museum and a library, and a hotel where you can watch anime will be opened.
施 設 Announced the facility outline at the business presentation held in Tokyo on October 31. Of the facilities that ordinary customers can visit and enjoy, the base is the Kadokawa Musashino Museum, which is positioned as a complex cultural museum. Designed by architect Kengo Tsuji, who also designed the new national stadium, the five-story building looks like a combination of rocks and polygons. Among them are the “Book Shelf Theater” and “Manga Ranobe Library” surrounded by a huge bookshelf that is about 8 meters high, and the “EJ Anime Museum” that introduces animation as a culture.
“EJ Anime Hotel”, where you can enjoy watching anime in the room, has 33 rooms. In addition, a shrine named “Musashino Mizuwashi Yamato Miyashiro” will be newly established for those who visit this place as a sacred place for anime.
Each facility will open sequentially, beginning with the Kadokawa Musashino Museum pre-opening on June 6 next year. KADOKAWA's book manufacturing factory and office functions will also move from time to time and will be fully operational in April 2021. The company expects the number of visitors after opening the business to be between 1.4 million and 1.8 million people a year, including employees and general customers.
